meanings.definition: The practice of equivocation or deceitful casuistry.
meanings.sent1: The jesuitry of the politician's words left the audience confused.
meanings.sent2: She saw through the jesuitry of his excuses and knew he was lying.
meanings.sent3: The magician's jesuitry with the disappearing rabbit amazed the children.
meanings.sent4: His jesuitry in negotiations made him seem like a master manipulator.
meanings.sent5: The jesuitry of the con artist was so convincing that many fell for his schemes.

meanings.definition: Deceptive or equivocal speech or action.
meanings.sent1: The company's jesuitry in their advertising misled many customers.
meanings.sent2: Detectives had to unravel the jesuitry of the criminal's alibi.
meanings.sent3: The comedian's jesuitry had the audience laughing at his clever wordplay.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was a mask for the jesuitry in her heart.
meanings.sent5: The spy's jesuitry was so subtle that even his allies were deceived.
